description: Daily events during the pope’s East Coast trip.
title: Pope Francis’ U.S. Visit Schedule
title_page: Pope Francis’ U.S. Visit Schedule - The New York Times
text:
Sept. 26
1 10:30 a.m. Mass at the Cathedral Basilica of Saints Peter and Paul, where more than 1,000 people are expected. The pope will arrive in a motorcade.
2 4:45 p.m. Speech at Independence Hall. Francis will talk about immigration and religious freedom at the lectern used by Abraham Lincoln to give the Gettysburg Address.
3 7:30 p.m. Festival of Families along Benjamin Franklin Parkway, where a million people are expected to gather. The event is open to the public, but the area in the immediate vicinity of the pope will require tickets. There will be a papal parade leading up to the festival.
